website_summaries.verdict: The Adidas Crazy Strike Low impresses fans with its cool aesthetics and modern style. Among the things players love about these sneakers are its lightweight comfort and its solid ankle protection. Testers also commended how easily this shoe breaks in. Some users, however, had minor issues regarding fit, noting that these Adidas sneakers run quite long and wide.Like the much celebrated Adidas shoes Dame 5 and Harden Vol 3, the Adidas Crazy Strike Low still gives good value for money considering that it is priced quite affordably.
pros: The Adidas Crazy Strike Low breaks in quickly according to players who tested it
Many reviewers commend these reliable basketball shoes for having a solid sole that offers good ankle protection
A good number of users love how comfortable these shoes fit out of the box
The cool look of this Adidas basketball shoe appeals to many wearers
These sneakers are ridiculously affordable, says a particular purchaser
Some testers appreciate the lightweight feel and excellent grip provided by the Crazy Strike Low
cons: Users point out that these basketball shoes run about half a size longer than the usual sizes
Based on what some reviewers had to say, the Adidas Crazy Strike Low lacks support for the feet
A specific user reports that the tread at the bottom of the shoe showed some wear after a few uses
One tester noticed that these Adidas sneakers are a bit wide-fitting

customer_reviews.title: adidas crazy strike low basketball shoes
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this shoe for my son's basketball season for use in his practices. the shoe has held up well and had no break in time. it has good support and grip. it has been comfortable from the first time he used the shoe. as he has been using it on outdoor basketball court at his school, the tread on the bottom of the shoe is showing some wear. overall, a very good shoe from adidas.
customer_reviews.author: bo

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: To be fair. the size finder told me to order one half-size down and I didn't. I expected them to be long and they are. I had read that they were narrow and they are. They are super cool looking and my kid loves them. They were ridiculously affordable. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L. Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basketball shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent basketball shoe. Good traction and support with style. Lighter weight than regular basketball shoes. Fit is true to size.
customer_reviews.author: R Moses

customer_reviews.title: For adidas-not so good
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad shoe-but it is a bit narrow and has no support
customer_reviews.author: Germanguy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based on my actual shoes size but this is a little wide than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Enrique Pinzon Trangay

customer_reviews.title: fit is good, traction very good
customer_reviews.text: use for basketball league play, fit is good, traction very good. I have wide feet and to wear these shoes I have to go up one whole size 10.5 4e to 11.5 d. come on adidas give a break to us wide footed guys. sell 2es and 4es
customer_reviews.author: Peg F.

customer_reviews.title: good grip for making cuts
customer_reviews.text: They run a little longer than expected - half size. With that being said they are extremely light, good grip for making cuts, and comfortable. I used to play in high school and pickup leagues ever since (I currently play 2/3 games a week) and these shoes have been great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 FULL SIZE TOO BIG
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool shoes for the low price. THEY ARE ONE SIZE TOO BIG, at least they were for me. I own nearly ten pairs of adidas size 10.5, and this is the only pair that has ever run big on me. I exchanged them for a sz 9.5 and they fit perfectly (just like any other 10.5 adidas shoe I own).
customer_reviews.author: Blaise Lezynski

customer_reviews.title: They run a 1/2 size big in my opinion!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason these were to big! I have been by Adidas for 20 years and it is always the same 9 1/2 all the time every time regardless of running, basketball, crossfit, all of them are 9 1/2, these felt like 10's or bigger. So I got a 9. Feel great ready to ball!!
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK D OLEARY

customer_reviews.title: great basketball shoe
customer_reviews.text: Since receiving the shoes I have played an hour of full court basketball. The shoes are comfortable and I did not get any blisters or hot spots. The shoes have great feel on freshly resea led wood; the traction is tremendous.
customer_reviews.author: Informed buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for b-ball
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes I thought they were a bit small but once I started wearing them they Grew in to my foot. Shoes look good but we will see if the material for some of the shoes hold up
customer_reviews.author: jessie m  hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not a great basketball shoe
customer_reviews.text: Not a great basketball shoe. more casual to running/workout shoe. fine for shooting around but the lack of support makes it difficult to really compete in them. super comfortable and stylish though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be a good cross-training shoe and an ok basketball shoe
customer_reviews.text: length is about a quarter inch long compared to a normal/ideal size fit. Would be a good cross-training shoe and an ok basketball shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Love the color combinations
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit as expected. Love the color combinations! Very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Omega112

customer_reviews.title: little too long and don't really like the look
customer_reviews.text: returning them. little too long and don't really like the look.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie howell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Look great just a little narrow was the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: amelia

customer_reviews.title: I need a good shoe. I've been a die-hard wearer of Adidas ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear low top basketball shoes when I teach my fitness classes. With all the lateral movement, I need a good shoe. I've been a die-hard wearer of Adidas since 1997. I can order my size and know they'll fit well. The *only* issue I had with these shoes was the traction, or lack thereof. When I teach kickboxing or hip hop, I slide around on these soles. Otherwise, everything else is awesome about these shoes. Outside, they are great but in a wood-sprung floor/fitness studio, I'd ask for more traction.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Vaughan

product_meta.title: adidas mens Crazy Strike Low-M Crazy Strike Low-m
product_meta.description: Seamlessly bonded SPRINTWEB provides breathable, lightweight support. ADIPRENE+ in the forefoot maintains propulsion and efficiency. Adaptive underlay for enhanced fit. SPRINTFRAME construction provides stability and speed through geometrical research to create a lightweight and supportive basketball chassis. NON MARKING rubber outsole
feature_bullets: A low-cut that threatens to strike from anywhere on the floor features a lightweight sprintweb upper sprintframe stability adiPRENE+ cushioning and unique 3-stripes heel branding
Sprintframe provides stability and speed through geometry to create a lightweight and supportive basketball chassis
